newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end weaker in all months.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end weaker in all months.

text.p: All contracts of Tokyo corn futures ended lower on Monday on the yen's rise against the dollar, but the price losses were narrower than expected, local traders said.
Prices ranged from 100 to 270 yen lower, with the benchmark May 1998 contract closing 220 yen down at 14,200 yen per tonne.
The day's estimated trading volume was 44,684 lots.
Active selling capped the topside from the opening, due to Chicago's price falls on Friday and the stronger yen, traders said, but they added the Tokyo market's losses were narrower than expected.
The benchmark May 1998 contract is unlikely to fall sharply below the 14,000 yen levels, they said.
The spot July corn contract on the CBOT Project A overnight trading system stood at $2.71-1/2 per bushel at 0755 GMT, down from $2.74 at Friday's close.
Spot July CBOT soybean futures were trading at $8.28 a bushel at 0755 GMT, down from $8.35-1/4 at Fridays' close.
